newsitem.title: CHINA: Chinese army plans to open HK bases to public - paper.
newsitem.headline: Chinese army plans to open HK bases to public - paper.

text.p: China's garrison in Hong Kong will open some of its bases to the public to boost understanding between the troops and the local community, a Beijing-controlled newspaper said on Monday.
The Wen Wei Po said the PLA would mount joint activities with local organisations to mark the People's Liberation Army's (PLA) 70th anniversary on August 1. It did not go into detail.
The newspaper said the PLA, which replaced British troops on July 1 after London handed its colony back to China, would open their gates to the public once they had settled in.
Many of Hong Kong's 6.4 million people view the PLA with alarm because of its role in the bloody 1989 crackdown against a student-led democracy movement in Beijing's Tiananmen Square.
